children.value: Cascading selection boxes are used for selecting multi-level data. Typical scenarios are province and city selection.
The cascading selection component can be used with Field and Popup components. Examples are as follows:

props.code:
<z-field
   v-model="fieldValue"
   is-link
   readonly
   label="region"
   placeholder="Please select your region"
   @click="show = true"
/>
<z-popup v-model:show="show" round position="bottom">
   <z-cascader
     v-model="cascaderValue"
     title="Please select your region"
     :options="options"
     @close="show = false"
     @finish="onFinish"
   />
</z-popup>

children.value: //Option list, children represents sub-options, supports multi-level nesting
//After all options are selected, the finish event will be triggered
The Cascader component is often used to select provinces and municipalities. The example project of
provides a Chinese province and municipality data, which can be downloaded and introduced into your own project:

props.code:
<z-field
   v-model="fieldValue"
   is-link
   readonly
   label="region"
   placeholder="Please select your region"
   @click="show = true"
/>
<z-popup v-model:show="show" round position="bottom">
   <z-cascader
     v-model="cascaderValue"
     title="Please select your region"
     :options="options"
     @close="show = false"
     @finish="onFinish"
   />
</z-popup>

children.value: property to set the highlight color of the selected state.

props.code:
<z-cascader
   v-model="cascaderValue"
   title="Please select your region"
   :options="options"
   active-color="#ee0a24"
   @close="show = false"
   @finish="onFinish"
/>

children.value: dynamically to implement asynchronous loading of options.

props.code:
<z-field
   v-model="fieldValue"
   is-link
   readonly
   label="region"
   placeholder="Please select your region"
   @click="show = true"
/>
<z-popup v-model:show="show" round position="bottom">
   <z-cascader
     v-model="cascaderValue"
     title="Please select your region"
     :options="options"
     @close="show = false"
     @change="onChange"
     @finish="onFinish"
   />
</z-popup>

children.value: Customize the content above the options
The value of the selected item
Whether to enable left and right sliding switching with gestures
Whether to display the close icon
Whether to display the title bar
Close the icon name or image link, which is equivalent to the
property is an array of objects. Each object in the array is configured with an option. The object can contain the following values:
The value corresponding to the option (required)
Add additional class for the corresponding column
Triggered when the selected item changes
Triggered after all options are selected
Triggered when the close icon is clicked
Triggered when a tab is clicked
Customize the content above the options
Customize the content below the options
The component provides the following CSS variables, which can be used to customize styles. For usage, please refer to

html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}

children.text: Customize the content above the options
